page.title: 02The A41 Trunk road.
page.content: On Wednesday 4th September 1985 we undertook a commercial vehicle survey of the A41 where it passed through our block. We discovered the lorries could be divided into three categories. 1. LOCAL TRAFFIC. This included; deliveries to villages and farms,traffic for Kineton ordance depot,animals for Banbury cattle market,traffic for General Foods of Banbury,cement from local cement works, and car parts for Fords in Leamington. 2.OXFORD/BIRMINGHAM TRAFFIC. This mainly consisted of cars,car bodies and car parts for the car industry at Cowley and Longbridge. 3.LONG DISTANCE TRAFFIC. This was lorries from the N.W.and N.E. heading for west London or the south coast and vice versa.
